newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: HANSOL PAPER TO PUT $100 MLN IN CHINA JV.
newsitem.headline: HANSOL PAPER TO PUT $100 MLN IN CHINA JV.

text.p: Hansol Paper Co Ltd, a unit of South Korea's Hansol Group, said on Wednesday it had agreed with its Chinese partner Jincheng Paper Corp Ltd to jointly invest $100 million to build a paper plant in Liaoning Province.
"We signed a letter of intent on the joint venture on Tuesday," said a Hansol spokesman.
He said the joint venture would be capitalised at $40 million, with more than 50 percent held by Hansol.
Construction of the plant would be completed by 2000 with an annual capacity of 100,000 tonnes.
